headline: ADBE Q2 Earnings Call: AI Adoption and Product Expansion Drive Upbeat Outlook
summary: Creative software maker Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 10.6% year on year to $5.87 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $5.9 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.06 per share was 1.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: ADBE Q2 Earnings Call: AI Adoption and Product Expansion Drive Upbeat Outlook
raw.summary: Creative software maker Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 10.6% year on year to $5.87 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $5.9 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.06 per share was 1.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Why Adobe (ADBE) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of creative software maker Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) fell 5% in the afternoon session after the company reported underwhelming second quarter 2025 (fiscal Q2) results, which failed to impress Wall Street. Recent price hikes to better monetize its AI offerings failed to improve the growth momentum, which remained range-bound in the low double-digit range. Notably, remaining performance obligations (RPO - key growth indicator) also fell below Wall Street's estimates.

raw.headline: Why Adobe (ADBE) Shares Are Falling Today

Notably, remaining performance obligations (RPO - key growth indicator) also fell below Wall Street's estimates.

headline: Adobe shares slide as investors skeptical of quicker AI-adoption returns
summary: (Reuters) -Adobe's shares dropped 7% in early trading on Friday as investors' concern that the company's AI adoption into its software tools could take longer to fetch returns, overshadowed a raised annual revenue forecast.  The company said in April that it would add AI models from OpenAI and Google to Firefly, its generative AI tool.  "While guidance was raised and management remains positive around demand generation, it feels like it will take more time to prove out these (AI) initiatives and quiet concerns of competition around GenAI," RBC analysts said in a note.

raw.headline: Adobe shares slide as investors skeptical of quicker AI-adoption returns
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Adobe's shares dropped 7% in early trading on Friday as investors' concern that the company's AI adoption into its software tools could take longer to fetch returns, overshadowed a raised annual revenue forecast.  The company said in April that it would add AI models from OpenAI and Google to Firefly, its generative AI tool.  "While guidance was raised and management remains positive around demand generation, it feels like it will take more time to prove out these (AI) initiatives and quiet concerns of competition around GenAI," RBC analysts said in a note.

headline: Adobe Is Not an 'AI Loser,' D.A. Davidson's Luria Says
summary: Gil Luria, D.A. Davidson managing director, says AI will be accretive to Adobe's earnings on the June 12 episode of "Bloomberg The Close." Adobe said sales will be about $5.88 billion to $5.93 billion in the period ending in August.

raw.headline: Adobe Is Not an 'AI Loser,' D.A. Davidson's Luria Says

headline: Adobe Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Stock Is Slumping.
summary: Adobe  reported better-than-expected second-quarter financial results on Thursday, raising its full-year revenue guidance as artificial intelligence drives demand.  “As a result of us driving strong performance in the first half of the year, we are pleased to raise Adobe’s FY25 total revenue and EPS targets,” CFO Dan Durn said.  Adobe also said it now expects full-year earnings to be between $20.50 and $20.70 a shares, compared with its prior call of $20.20 to $20.50.

raw.headline: Adobe Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Stock Is Slumping.
raw.summary: Adobe  reported better-than-expected second-quarter financial results on Thursday, raising its full-year revenue guidance as artificial intelligence drives demand.  “As a result of us driving strong performance in the first half of the year, we are pleased to raise Adobe’s FY25 total revenue and EPS targets,” CFO Dan Durn said.  Adobe also said it now expects full-year earnings to be between $20.50 and $20.70 a shares, compared with its prior call of $20.20 to $20.50.

headline: RH tariffs, Adobe outlook, Walmart & Amazon: Trending Tickers
summary: RH (RH) stock is surging after the company said it is taking efforts to reduce tariff costs by moving production out of China and increasing US production. The company also affirmed its sales forecast and topped first quarter earnings expectations. Adobe (ADBE) stock is under pressure despite raising its full-year outlook and reporting record-high sales in its second quarter. Walmart (WMT) and Amazon (AMZN) are reportedly considering issuing their own stablecoins, which could allow the retailers to avoid significant fees from traditional payment systems. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

raw.headline: RH tariffs, Adobe outlook, Walmart & Amazon: Trending Tickers
raw.summary: RH (RH) stock is surging after the company said it is taking efforts to reduce tariff costs by moving production out of China and increasing US production. The company also affirmed its sales forecast and topped first quarter earnings expectations. Adobe (ADBE) stock is under pressure despite raising its full-year outlook and reporting record-high sales in its second quarter.
